column4: Hi, im running Kubuntu 6.06 LTS, Id like to use GNOME too (both), but when I try to install ubuntu-desktop I get some errors about langauge-selector and libglib2.0-data ?
how do I play .ram/.rm files inside firefox using mozilla-mplayer? The rest works but not ram/rm
have you installed w32codecs?
yes
have a link to some rm file?  I'll find out what codec my mplayer is using
http://news.bbc.co.uk/olmedia/1535000/video/_1537692_planeone_footage09_vi.ram
does http://info.linspire.com/lindows/audiovideo/TSS_Lindows.rm work for you?
yeah it does

yeah, this is what I get when I run mplayer from a terminal with your link:  You need to obtain a new player to play this clip. Please point your web browser to http://www.real.com and download the latest RealOne Player from RealNetworks. Once you have installed it you should try this clip again.
thanks mate
I'm not sure if it's just an identification problem
I cant find RealOne, only RealPlayer
and I cant see any linux version either
realplayer 10 is in the repositories, idk about real one
sudo apt-get install realplayer gives me some error about xlibs
'realplay' should be the name of the package.  It is in edgy commercial
I mean dapper commercial
cant find realplay, only realplayer
have you enabled the dapper-commercial repository?
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RealplayerInstallationMethods
cheers, installing realplay now
alright, realplayer 10 works now, I just copy paste the url in the player, ill look later into how to watch it in firefox, thanks for all your help!
np
